subject: Boats and Boating
Suits and Litigation
lead_paragraph: San Francisco’s Golden Gate Yacht Club sued the two-time America’s Cup champion Alinghi yesterday, seeking to replace the Spanish syndicate Desafio Español as the official challenger for the next regatta. Golden Gate asserted that Club Nautica Español de Vela was an “invalid challenger” because it never held a regatta as stipulated in the rules of the “deed of gift,” the regulations that govern the America’s Cup. The suit was filed in the State of New York’s Supreme Court, which has jurisdiction to settle all disputes in the competition.
